702606f-a.title: Brooklyn: 18th Avenue - 81st Street
702606f-a.text:
(1)
Eighteenth Ave., east side, from and including 81st to and includ-
ing 82nd Streets, showing the Van Pelt Manor. Also showing between the
two benches in the foreground, is the milestone which reads:- 8 14 miles
to New York Ferry. This road to Denys' Perry 2 1 2 miles; 10 18 miles
to New York Ferry. This road to Jamaica 15 miies. It also'marked
the postroad from Boston to Philadelphia.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(21
Same, showing side view of house.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(3) Same, from the other side.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

702853f-a.title: Brooklyn: 81st Street - 18th Street
702853f-a.text:
1776-177S A1st Street, south side, west of Eighteenth Ave., showing the
Dr. Carpenter house, formerly at 8212 Eighteenth Ave., at its new location.
March 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

702604f-a.title: Brooklyn: 18th Avenue - 81st Street
702604f-a.text:
(1)
8024 Eighteenth Ave., at the N.W. corner of 81st Street, showing
a rear view of the home of Mrs. Wardell which was erected in 1873. In
1929 the Bensonhurst Garden Apartments occupied the site.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, showing another house on Eighteenth Ave.
March 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
